what: Redefining High Variable Genes Using LOESS Regression with Positive Ratio
title: Redefining High Variable Genes Using LOESS Regression with Positive Ratio
text: GLP R package designed efficient feature selection single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq) analyses. identifies highly variable genes (HVGs) analyzing relationship positive ratio average expression level. package uses optimized LOESS regression automatic bandwidth selection based Bayesian Information Criterion (BIC) applies Tukey’s biweight method reduce impact outliers. GLP offers improved accuracy gene selection, helping preserve essential biological information downstream analyses.

text: can install development version GLP GitHub :

title: Redefining High Variable Genes Using LOESS Regression with Positive Ratio
text: basic example shows solve common problem: First，need read data: {r example} library(Seurat) library(ggplot2) data <- readRDS("./tests/PBMC.rds") , second step calculate expression informations gene. offer calculate_gpr: {r cars} counts <- data@assays$RNA@counts gene.info <- calculate_gpr(counts) head(gene.info) | exp.mean | positive_rate | pcount | gene | |———:|—————|——-:|———-| | 0| 0| 0|MIR1302-10| | 0| 0| 0| FAM138A| | 0| 0| 0| OR4F5| genes zero expression level removed next step. second step core step, perform robust LOESS regression identify potential highly variable genes： {r pressure, echo = FALSE} hvg <- glp(df) reg <- hvg$Genes.regression ggplot(reg, aes(x=positive_rate, y=exp.mean, color=hvg)) + geom_point() +     geom_line(data=reg, aes(x=positive_rate, y=fit), color="green",size=1.5)+      coord_cartesian(xlim = c(0, 0.5),ylim=c(0,7))+     theme(axis.title.x = element_text(size=20),          axis.text.x = element_text(size=15, angle = 0, hjust = 0.9),          axis.title.y = element_text(size=20),             axis.text.y = element_text(size=15),           legend.position = "top",           panel.grid = element_blank(),           panel.background = element_rect(fill="white", color="black")) potential HVGs selected GLP stored hvg$HVG.
